Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}, plus an additional {1} for each card you own in exile.

cards.notes:
Disrupt Opponent’s Creatures

FT Lore — Nightmares and Shadows try to claim the power of the stars, even if it destroys them. I imagine that power derived from light is essentially poison to them.

...in the light vs ...for the light ?

Art could change

I — Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
II — Scry 2.
III — Exile the top card of your library. If its a nonland card with mana value 2 or less, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.

cards.rules_text:

cards.rules_text:

Flying, vigilance
Suspend 3—{1}{W}{W} [i](Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{W}{W} and exile it with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, you may cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)[/i]

Kicker {3} [i](You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell.)[/i]
Exile target nonland permanent if it’s tapped, if it’s an artifact or enchantment, or if this spell was kicked.

Whenever a time counter is removed from Farwalker Herd while it’s exiled, you may search your library for a basic Plains card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
Suspend 1—{2}{W} [i](Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {2}{W} and exile it with a time counter on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, you may cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)[/i]
Whenever a time counter is removed from a card you own in exile, put a +1/+1 counter on Loyal Realmguard.

cards.special_text:
Put your choice of a +1/+1 counter, a vigilance counter, or a lifelink counter on target artifact or enchantment you control.
Until end of turn, target noncreature artifact or enchantment you control becomes a creature in addition to its other types. Its base power and toughness are each equal to the number of lore counters on Breathe Life.

cards.rules_text:
Flash
When Wooly Hermit enters, exile another target nonland permanent. For as long as that card remains exiled, its owner may cast it without paying its mana cost.
Suspend 2—{1}{U} [i](Rather than cast this card from your hand, you may pay {1}{U} and exile it with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter. When the last is removed, you may cast it without paying its mana cost. It has haste.)[/i]

When Mirror Trap enters, exile target nonland permanent until Mirror Trap leaves the battlefield.
When Mirror Trap enters, create a white Reflection enchantment creature token with “This creature’s power and toughness are each equal to the number of enchantments you control.”

Whenever Chittering Burrower deals combat damage to a player, muse 1. [i](Choose a counter on another permanent you control or a card you own in in exile. Remove it or add another.)[/i]
Whenever Chittering Burrower is put into exile from anywhere, create a 1/1 white Squirrel creature token with  “Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, muse 1.”

Gallant Bonebreaker enters with a +1/+1 counter on it.
At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you control no tapped lands, Gallant Bonebreaker gains double strike until end of turn.
Whenever you cast a spell from exile, tap target creature.

Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has flying.
When Uplift is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may exile it. If you do, return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

Exile the top five cards of your library, then choose any number of nonland permanent cards with total mana value 5 or less from among cards exiled this way, cards in your graveyard, and cards on the battlefield. Destroy each card chosen this way that’s on the battlefield and put the rest into their owners’ hands.

Whenever Branchwefting or another nontoken enchantment enters under your control, create a 1/1 white Squirrel creature token with “Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, muse 1.” [i](Choose a counter on another permanent you control or a card you own in in exile. Remove it or add another.)[/i]

Menace
If you would put two or more time counters on a card you own in exile, put that many minus one on that card instead.

Whenever Crazed Curator enters or attacks, you may put a suspended card you own into your graveyard. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Crazed Curator and draw a card.
Crazed Curator can’t block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.

Prowess
[i]Unnerve[/i] — At the beginning of your end step, if a card you own was put into exile this turn, exile the top card of your library. You may play that card until the end of your next turn.
Whenever you cast a spell from anywhere other than your hand, Splinterhorn Pugilist gains trample and haste until end of turn. Scry 1.

[i]Unnerve [/i]— Whenever a card you own is put into exile, until end of turn, Voltaic Manifestation becomes a 5/5 Dragon Elemental creature in addition to its other types, and it gains flying, trample, and haste.

Static Strangle deals 4 damage to target creature. 
Exile Static Strangle.
Damage can’t be prevented this turn. Unfathomable Stoke deals X damage to target creature and 1 damage to each other creature with the same controller.
Discard a card unless Incredulous Revelation is the second spell you’ve cast this turn. Then, draw two cards.
cards.notes: Would need to change if common changes.

cards.rules_text:
Choose one—
• When you cast your next instant or sorcery spell this turn, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
• Exile target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard and put two time counters on it. If it doesn’t have suspend, it gains suspend.

If a creature you control would deal damage to an opponent or a permanent an opponent controls, it deals that much damage plus 1 instead. 
Whenever you cast your second spell each turn, creatures you control gain trample until end of turn.

Choose one. If this spell was cast from exile, you may choose both instead —
• Target creature you control gets +2/+0 until end of turn and fights target creature you don’t control.
• Destroy target artifact or nonbasic land.
Suspend 1— {3}{R}{R}
Rumination Golem enters with two +1/+1 counters on it. If you spent three mana of the same color to cast it, it enters with three +1/+1 counters instead.
Sacrifice Dream Servant: Put target suspend card into its owner’s graveyard. Activate only as a sorcery.
This spell costs {X} less to cast, where X is the greatest number of permanents you control that each share a color.

When Nightsnare enters, exile target creature.
{4}, Sacrifice Nightsnare: Create a 0/0 blue and black Nightmare creature token. Put X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the exiled card’s power.

As Nostalgic Vista enters, choose a color. Nostalgic Vista enters tapped unless you control three or more permanents of the chosen color.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color.
{4}, {T}, Exile Nostalgic Vista: Return target card of the chosen color from your graveyard to your hand.

Haste
Horizon Elemental gets +1/+1 for each time counter among suspended cards you own.

Flying
When Coalwing Snapper enters, if only red and/or colorless mana was spent to cast it, exile up to one target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard. If you do, copy it. You may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

Whenever Paranoia Clutcher deals combat damage to a player, at the beginning of your next main phase, you lose that much life and add that much mana in any combination of colors.

If a face-up creature card you own in exile has flying, Compounded Nightmares has flying. The same is true for first strike, double strike, deathtouch, haste, hexproof, indestructible, lifelink, menace, reach, trample, and vigilance.

Exile cards from the top of your library until you have exiled cards with total mana value X or more. For each nonland card exiled this way, put two time counters on it, then if it doesn’t have suspend, it gains suspend.
